txt_en: Never eat more than you can lift.
txt_cn: 吃的永远不要比能拿的多。
author: Miss Piggy

txt_en: Nothing is impossible. Some things are just less likely than others.
txt_cn: 没有什么是不可能的，只是有些事可能性比其他的小一点而已。
author: Jonathan Winters

txt_en: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
txt_cn: 自信是成大事的首要条件。
author: Samuel Johnson

txt_en: Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
txt_cn: 教育的目的是使空洞的大脑变得开放宽广。
author: Malcolm Forbes

txt_en: Life wouldn't be worth living if I worried over the future as well as the present.
txt_cn: 如果我既担忧未来又担忧现在，那么这样的生活不值得我去过。
author: W. Somerset Maugham

txt_en: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
txt_cn: 我常常引用自己的话，它可以为我的谈话增添点色彩。
author: George Bernard Shaw

txt_en: Every day, in every way, I am getting better and better.
txt_cn: 每一天，我都在以各种方式变得越来越好。
author: Émile Coué

txt_en: Simplicity is the peak of civilization.
author: Jessie Sampter

txt_en: Only the mediocre are always at their best.
txt_cn: 只有平庸的人才会永远在他们最好的状态。
author: Jean Giraudoux

txt_en: It is not necessary to understand things in order to argue about them.
txt_cn: 没有必要为了争论事物而去理解事物。
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

txt_en: Parents were invented to make children happy by giving them something to ignore.
txt_cn: 父母的存在，是有意让孩子忽略一些事情，从而让他们感到欢乐。
author: Ogden Nash

txt_en: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
txt_cn: 一台机器能干五十个普通人的活，但一个杰出的人的工作没有机器可以做。
author: Elbert Hubbard

txt_en: The world is full of willing people, some willing to work, the rest willing to let them.
txt_cn: 这个世界充满了乐于做事的人。一些人乐意工作，其余的人乐意让他们工作。
author: Robert Frost

txt_en: While we try to teach our children all about life, our children teach us what life is all about.
txt_cn: 当我们教会孩子生活的一切时，孩子却教会我们什么是生活的真谛。
author: Angela Schwindt

txt_en: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
txt_cn: 世上只有两种东西是无限的：宇宙以及人类的愚蠢。而对于前者，我还不太确定。
author: Albert Einstein

txt_en: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
txt_cn: 你是无法靠你打算去做的事情树立名声的。
author: Henry Ford

txt_en: You must first have a lot of patience to learn to have patience.
txt_cn: 你首先得耐下心，才能学会有耐心。
author: Stanislaw J. Lec

txt_en: If a thing isn't worth saying, you sing it.
txt_cn: 如果一件事不值得说出来，你就把它唱出来吧。
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

txt_en: Everyone is born with genius, but most people only keep it a few minutes.
txt_cn: 每个人生来都是天才，但大多数人只把天资保留了几分钟。
author: Edgard Varese
